parameter.name: tpm_tcti_name
parameter.description:
Specifies the TCTI (Trusted Computing Technology Interface) to use when communicating with a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) for secure key operations. This setting is only relevant when .B hsm_type is set to .B tpm or .B tpm_if_possible.
Common values include:
\(bu .B device:/dev/tpmrm0 \(en This uses the kernel TPM resource manager device, which is the recommended default for most Linux systems.
Other TCTI strings may be required depending on your system's TPM driver or configuration. This option allows advanced control over how Himmelblau connects to the TPM for performing cryptographic operations.
